name: beryllium hydroxide production | beryllium hydroxide | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/23378/documentation

This dataset represents global production of beryllium hydroxide (Be(OH)2). It is an extrapolation from the respective US dataset. Beryllium is commercially extracted from the minerals beryl and bertrandite, the latter being the economically more important one (Petzow et al. 2005). In 2016, 70 % of the global beryllium production came from the US, where bertrandite is the only beryllium source. The processing methods for the 2 different ores differ but due to its higher economic importance, only bertrandite processing is considered in this dataset. An average bertrandite ore grade of 0.248% beryllium and a recovery rate of 88 % were assumed (Materion Corp. 2018). Be(OH)2 is an intermediate product and can be used to produce beryllium oxide, beryllium alloys and beryllium metal. Be(OH)2 has a Be content of 20.95%.;Petzow, G., Aldinger, F., Jönsson, S., Welge, P., van Kampen, V., Mensing, T., Brüning, T., 2005. Beryllium and Beryllium Compounds. In 'Ullmann’s Encyclopedia of Industrial Chemistry'. Wiley-VCH Verlag GmbH & Co. KGaA, Weinheim, Germany, p. 71. https://doi.org/10.1002/14356007.a04_011.pub2;Materion Corp., 2018. Materion 2018 Annual Report.

The activity starts with the construction of the mine side and the extraction of the ore.

The activity ends with the production beryllium hydroxide
category: C:Manufacturing/24:Manufacture of basic metals/242:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals/2420:Manufacture of basic precious and other non-ferrous metals

processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Bertrandite ore is mined using the open pit method. The ore is dissolved in sulfuric acid and insoluble residues such as silica and aluminum are removed. Solvent extraction is applied us-ing organic solvents such as ammonium di-2-ethylhexyl phosphate/di-2-ethylhexyl phos-phoric acid/kerosene (DAP). Ammonium carbonate solution is used to separate beryllium from the organic phase. Since the organic phase is returned to the process it is not accounted for. Metal impurities are removed by heat treatment.
processDocumentation.dataTreatmentDescription: This dataset is an extrapolation from the respective US dataset. The uncertainty was adjusted accordingly

exchanges.description: The total amount of gangue and beryllium mined is calculated by dividing the amount of Be in ground needed for the production of 1 Kg beryllium hydroxide (considering the recovery rate of Be) by the ore grade of bertrandite ore. Finally, the amount of Be mined is subtracted from the total.

flow.name: Gangue
flow.category: Elementary flows/Resource/in ground
